result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R Reetz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts
parties.address: 333 Vine St., Room 1200, La Crosse, WI 54601

supervisions.notes:
During period of prison incarceration, 25% of the defendant's Prison Inmate funds are to be applied toward restitution owed per prison policy
.

superMiscConds.notes:
No Contact with Brian G. or Karen P.
.

Pay restitution of $275.68 to Brian G.  Restitution is to be held open for 60 days to determine any other amount owed

Pay 10% restitution surcharge to the La Crosse Co DA's office

During period of Extended Supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations as deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommendations

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt
